title: [Large-scale] Information Theory and Optimization Problems: Core Concepts and Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Probability Theory and Linear Algebra Knowledge, Programming Basics
context.additional_context: Short intensive course on applying core information theory concepts and optimization techniques to real-world problems, combining lectures with practical case analyses

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of Information Bottleneck (IB) and Privacy Funnel (PF) theories.
Learners can define optimization problems using mutual information measurement methods and derive solutions.
Learners can explain how to apply information-theoretic approaches to real-world problems (e.g., hypothesis testing, data compression, privacy protection).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
